attachments.title: What is the difference between " is None " and " ==None "
attachments.text: I recently came across this syntax, I am unaware of the difference. I would appreciate it if someone could tell me the difference.
attachments.fallback: What is the difference between " is None " and " ==None "

text: small point i mentioned in lab, in python the convention when doing a comparison to none is `foo is None` not `foo == None`
the reason is that in python you can change the behavior of how objects react to `==`
so in the second example, the guy defines the method `__eq__` and has it always return `True`
`is None` is predictable and you cant mess with it the same way
This is all just an FYI, you’re not responsible for any of that information
